Event: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak cancels part of the high-speed rail project to Manchester, citing a need to redirect funds to other transport projects.
Blinken tells Arab leaders that there can be 'no more business as usual' with Hamas, following deadly attacks in Israel.
Blinken and Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu shelter in a bunker during a meeting in Tel Aviv as air raid sirens sound.
US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken warns Lebanon to remain out of the conflict between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas.
Blinken rebuffs Arab states' push for an immediate Gaza ceasefire, arguing that it would allow Hamas to regroup.
Blinken says 'far too many' Palestinians have been killed in the conflict between Israel and Hamas, and calls for more protection of civilians.
Jordan's foreign minister expresses doubts about Israel's ability to eliminate Hamas.
